# drawBorderAndBackground(withFrame:in:)

**Instance Method**

Draws the borders and background associated with the receiver’s menu item (if any).

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func drawBorderAndBackground(withFrame cellFrame: NSRect, in controlView: NSView)
```

## Parameters

- **cellFrame**: A rectangle defining the receiver’s frame area.
- **controlView**: The view object that contains this cell (usually an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSControl] object).

## Discussion

This method invokes the `NSCell` method [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell/imageRect(forBounds:)], passing it `cellFrame`, to calculate the rectangle in which to draw the image. The cell invokes this method before invoking the methods to draw the other menu item components.

## Related Documentation

- **draw(withFrame:in:)**: Draws the receiver’s border and then draws the interior of the cell.

## Drawing the Menu Item

- **drawImage(withFrame:in:)**: Draws the image associated with the menu item.
- **drawKeyEquivalent(withFrame:in:)**: Draws the key equivalent associated with the menu item.
- **drawSeparatorItem(withFrame:in:)**: Draws a menu item separator.
- **drawStateImage(withFrame:in:)**: Draws the state image associated with the menu item.
- **drawTitle(withFrame:in:)**: Draws the title associated with the menu item.
- **needsDisplay**: A Boolean value indicating whether the menu item needs to be displayed.
